meanings.definition: Hokier (comparative adjective): corny or overly sentimental in a way that is considered humorous or ridiculous.
meanings.sent1: The movie's plot became even hokier as it progressed.
meanings.sent2: Her jokes are getting hokier with each telling.
meanings.sent3: The hokier the pun, the louder the laughter.
meanings.sent4: His attempts at being cool were as hokier than a clown's oversized shoes.
meanings.sent5: The hokier the love song, the more people sing along.

meanings.definition: Hokier (adverb): in a manner that is excessively sentimental or corny.
meanings.sent1: She sang hokier than expected at the karaoke night.
meanings.sent2: The actor delivered his lines hokier than the script intended.
meanings.sent3: The play ended hokier than a soap opera cliffhanger.
meanings.sent4: The speech was delivered so hokier that the audience cringed.
meanings.sent5: The decorations were arranged hokier than a Pinterest fail.

meanings.definition: Hokier (noun): a person or thing that is considered overly sentimental or corny.
meanings.sent1: She's a real hokier when it comes to romantic gestures.
meanings.sent2: The movie was full of hokiers that made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent3: The party was a gathering of hokiers sharing their favorite cheesy jokes.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the office hokier for his love of sappy movies.
meanings.sent5: The book club attracted all the hokiers who loved tear-jerker novels.
